intro: Eritrichium circumscissum, commonly known as the alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps and other mountainous regions. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its small, delicate flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eritrichium circumscissum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
